holidays.name: National Cheese Doodle Day
holidays.description: A crunchy, cheesy celebration dedicated to those orange, puffy, finger-staining snacks we all know and love â€“ cheese doodles! Perfect for munching while binge-watching or sharing at parties.
holidays.origin: Originated in the United States to honor the snack beloved since its invention in the mid-20th century by the Adams-Millis company.
holidays.funFact: Cheese doodles were accidentally created when a machine designed to make potato chips produced puffed corn curls instead!

holidays.name: Multiple Personality Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about Dissociative Identity Disorder (previously known as Multiple Personality Disorder) and to promote understanding and compassion for those living with the condition.
holidays.origin: Established by psychologist Dr. Arnold D. Richards in 1996 to bring attention to DID and reduce stigma.
holidays.funFact: March 5 was chosen because it's the birthday of Hervey Cleckley, a notable psychiatrist who contributed to the study of dissociative disorders.

holidays.name: Teacher's Day (Czechia and Slovakia)
holidays.description: Celebrates educators and their important role in shaping future generations, coinciding with the birthday of famous educator John Amos Comenius.
holidays.origin: Honors John Amos Comenius, a 17th-century educator who is considered the father of modern education.
holidays.funFact: Comenius advocated for universal education and was one of the first to use pictures in textbooks to aid learning.

holidays.name: Make Up Your Own Holiday Day
holidays.description: A whimsy day encouraging people to invent and celebrate their very own holiday, no matter how quirky or random!
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday created by fun-loving people who felt there should be a day dedicated to creativity and imagination.
holidays.funFact: This day has no rulesâ€”some have created holidays like 'Talk Like a Pirate Day' or 'Dress Like Your Pet Day' on this date!
